raw_text:
Candidate resigns over BNP link
 
 A prospective candidate for the UK Independence Party (UKIP) has resigned after admitting a "brief attachment" to the British National Party(BNP).
 
 Nicholas Betts-Green, who had been selected to fight the Suffolk Coastal seat, quit after reports in a newspaper that he attended a BNP meeting. The former teacher confirmed he had attended the meeting but said that was the only contact he had with the group. Mr Betts-Green resigned after being questioned by the party's leadership. A UKIP spokesman said Mr Betts-Green's resignation followed disclosures in the East Anglian Daily Times last month about his attendance at a BNP meeting. "He did once attend a BNP meeting. He did not like what he saw and heard and will take no further part of it," the spokesman added. A meeting of Suffolk Coastal UKIP members is due to be held next week to discuss a replacement. Mr Betts-Green, of Woodbridge, Suffolk, has also resigned as UKIP's branch chairman.
llama3.2:1b: A prospective UKIP candidate, Nicholas Betts-Green, has resigned after admitting to attending a British National Party meeting in the past. He was questioned by party leadership and later confirmed to have attended the meeting. He resigned following disclosures from an East Anglian newspaper.
llama3.2:3b: A UK Independence Party (UKIP) candidate, Nicholas Betts-Green, has resigned after admitting to attending a British National Party meeting and stating he will take no further part in the group.
gemma2:2b: Nicholas Betts-Green, UKIP candidate for Suffolk Coastal seat, resigned after admitting attending a BNP meeting and facing criticism from the party's leadership. He claims he did not support the BNP after attending the meeting. A replacement will be chosen by UKIP members at a meeting next week.
qwen2.5:0.5b: UKIP member Nicholas Betts-Green resigned from his position at the UK Independence Party (UKIP) over BNP's involvement in a meeting attended by him. The former teacher confirmed he had attended a BNP meeting but said it was only "the one contact" he had with the group. He has also resigned as branch chairman, and the UKIP spokesman described this as follows: "He did once attend a BNP meeting. He did not like what he saw and heard and will take no further part of it."
qwen2.5:1.5b: A candidate for UKIP resigns over BNP affiliation after admitting to attending a BNP meeting; former teacher confirmed attendance but stated it was the only contact with the group.
qwen2.5:3b: A prospective UK Independence Party (UKIP) candidate, Nicholas Betts-Green, quit after admitting to attending one BNP meeting. He confirmed it was his only contact with the group and said he did not like what he saw or heard. Betts-Green resigned following a newspaper report and being questioned by UKIP leadership. A replacement for his Suffolk Coastal seat will be discussed at an upcoming UKIP member meeting, and he has also stepped down as branch chairman.
opencoder:1.5b:
Candidate resigns over BNP link.

A prospective candidate for the UK Independence Party (UKIP) has resigned after admitting a "brief attachment" to the British National Party(BNP). Nicholas Betts-Green, who had been selected to fight the Suffolk Coastal seat, quit after reports in a newspaper that he attended a BNP meeting. The former teacher said he had attended the meeting but said that was the only contact he had with the group. Mr Betts-Green resigned after being questioned by the party's leadership. A UKIP spokesman added that Mr Betts-Green's resignation followed disclosures in the East Anglian Daily Times last month about his attendance at a BNP meeting. "He did once attend a BNP meeting. He did not like what he saw and heard and will take no further part of it," the spokesman explained. A meeting of Suffolk Coastal UKIP members is due to be held next week to discuss a replacement. Mr Betts-Green, of Woodbridge, has also resigned as UKIP's branch chairman.
smollm:1.7b: The candidate resigned over BNP link after admitting a brief attachment to the party.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize this text about a candidate resigning for the UKIP. First, I'll read through the entire passage carefully.

The main points are that a prospective candidate, Nicholas Betts-Green, has quit because of his role in the BNP meeting. He met with the party's leadership but didn't stay. There were two news headlines mentioning this: one from the East Anglian Daily Times and another from the Suffolk Coastal Times. The spokesperson for UKIP said he attended a BNP meeting once, didn't like what they saw, and won't join anymore.

I should make sure to include all key details without adding extra information. I'll keep it concise, focusing on the main resignation because that's the summary required.
</think>

A prospective candidate, Nicholas Betts-Green, resigns for the UK Independence Party (UKIP) after attending a brief BNP meeting and being questioned by party leadership. He also resigned as UKIP's branch chairman. A meeting is scheduled next week to discuss a replacement.
tinyllama:1.1b: The candidate for the UK Independence Party (UKIP) has resigned after admitting to attending a BNP meeting, and the former teacher who was selected to contest the Suffolk Coastal seat did so after being reported in a newspaper for having attended a brief attachment. The announcement of Mr Betts-Green's departure from the party comes following reports that he attended the meeting but denied any further involvement with the BNP. It is not clear if a replacement will be selected, and the decision to do so was discussed by UKIP's membership at a meeting next week.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Summary: Prospective candidate for the UK Independence Party (UKIP) resigns over BNP link, after admitting to having attended a BNP meeting and later withdrawing from the race due to criticism.

He confirmed attending a BNP meeting and expressed dissatisfaction with what he saw and heard. Mr Betts-Green also announced his resignation as UKIP's branch chairman. A replacement is being sought for the Suffolk Coastal seat.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Nicholas Betts-Green, a prospective candidate for the UK Independence Party (UKIP) in the Suffolk Coastal seat, resigned following revelations that he attended a British National Party (BNP) meeting. Despite this single encounter, Mr. Betts-Green stated he found the group's ideologies unappealing and would not associate with them further. His decision to quit came after questioning by UKIP's leadership, following publication of his attendance in the East Anglian Daily Times last month. He also relinquished his role as UKIP's branch chairman. A party meeting is scheduled for next week to choose a replacement candidate.
